description: All tables related to Azure Active Directory logs.
icmTeam: IAM Services/IAM - Data Insights and Reporting Service

tables.description: Microsoft applications' service principal sign-in logs.

columns.name: AppId
columns.description: Unique GUID representing the app ID in Entra ID.

columns.name: AppOwnerTenantId
columns.description: The tenant identifier of the owner of the application in Entra ID.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Category of the sign-in event

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: ID to provide sign-in trail

columns.name: CreatedDateTime
columns.description: Datetime of the sign-in activity.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: The duration of the operation in milliseconds

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: For sign-ins, this value is always Sign-in activity

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The REST API version that's requested by the client

columns.name: ResourceDisplayName
columns.description: Name of the resource that was authenticated to

columns.name: ResourceGroup
columns.description: Resource group for the logs

columns.name: ResourceIdentity
columns.description: ID of the resource that was authenticated to

columns.name: ResourceOwnerTenantId
columns.description: The tenant ID of the owner of the resource being authenticated to

columns.name: ResourceServicePrincipalId
columns.description: Service Principal Id of the resource

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: The result of the sign-in. Can be either success or failure

columns.name: ServicePrincipalCredentialKeyId
columns.description: Key id of the service principal that initiated the sign-in

columns.name: ServicePrincipalCredentialThumbprint
columns.description: Thumbprint of the service principal that initiated the sign-in

columns.name: ServicePrincipalId
columns.description: ID of the service principal who initiated the sign-in

columns.name: ServicePrincipalName
columns.description: Service Principal Name of the service principal who initiated the sign-in

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: Details of source system of the object being provisioned

columns.name: TenantId
columns.description: The tenant GUID that's associated with the logs

columns.name: Type
columns.description: For sign-ins, this value is always MicrosoftServicePrincipalSignInLogs

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC

columns.name: UniqueTokenIdentifier
columns.description: Unique token identifier for the request

tables.name: AADCustomSecurityAttributeAuditLogs
tables.description: Non-interactive Azure Active Directory sign-in logs from user.

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: Details of source system of the object being provisioned.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: Name of the operation.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The REST API version that's requested by the client.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The result of the audit operation can be Success or Failure.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: Contains the error code, if any, for the audit operation.

columns.name: ResultDescription
columns.description: Provides the error description for the audit operation.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: The duration of the operation in milliseconds.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: ID to provide audit trail.

columns.name: Identity
columns.description: The identity from the token that was presented when you made the request. It can be a user account, system account, or service principal.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the event.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The region of the resource emitting the event.

columns.name: AdditionalDetails
columns.description: Indicates additional details on the activity. Can have any string as a key or value.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: Unique ID representing the audit activity.

columns.name: InitiatedBy
columns.description: User or app initiated the activity.

columns.name: LoggedByService
columns.description: Service that initiated the activity.

columns.name: Result
columns.description: Result of the activity. Possible values are: success failure timeout unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: ResultReason
columns.description: Describes cause of failure or timeout results.

columns.name: TargetResources
columns.description: Indicates information on which resource was changed due to the activity.

columns.name: AADTenantId
columns.description: ID of the AAD tenant.

columns.name: ActivityDisplayName
columns.description: Activity name or the operation name.

columns.name: ActivityDateTime
columns.description: Date and time the activity was performed in UTC.

columns.name: AADOperationType
columns.description: Type of the operation. Possible values are Add Update Delete and Other.

columns.name: CallerIpAddress
columns.description: IP address of caller.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: User agent of initiator.

tables.name: AADNonInteractiveUserSignInLogs
tables.description: Non-interactive Azure Active Directory sign-in logs from user.

columns.name: TenantId
columns.description: The tenant GUID that's associated with the logs.

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: Details of source system of the object being provisioned.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: For sign-ins, this value is always Sign-in activity.

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The REST API version that's requested by the client.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Category of the sign-in event.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The result of the sign-in operation can be Success or Failure.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: Contains the error code, if any, for the sign-in operation.

columns.name: ResultDescription
columns.description: Provides the error description for the sign-in operation.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: The duration of the operation in milliseconds.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: ID to provide sign-in trail.

columns.name: ResourceGroup
columns.description: Resource group for the logs.

columns.name: Identity
columns.description: The identity from the token that was presented when you made the request. It can be a user account, system account, or service principal.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The severity level of the event.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The region of the resource emitting the event.

columns.name: AADTenantId
columns.description: The AADTenantId GUID that's associated with the logs

columns.name: Agent
columns.description: Details of agentic sign-in.

columns.name: AlternateSignInName
columns.description: Provides the on-premises UPN of the user sign-ing into Azure AD.e.g. Phone number sign-in.

columns.name: AppDisplayName
columns.description: App name displayed in the Azure portal.

columns.name: AppId
columns.description: Unique GUID representing the app ID in the Azure Active Directory.

columns.name: AppliedEventListeners
columns.description: Detailed information about the applied event listeners or listeners that are triggered by the corresponding events in an authentication activity. It's called appliedEventListeners in ALP and MSGraph, but use Authentication Events to match name on UX.

columns.name: AppOwnerTenantId
columns.description: The tenant identifier of the owenr of the application in Azure Active Directory.

columns.name: AuthenticationContextClassReferences
columns.description: The authentication contexts of the sign-in.

columns.name: AuthenticationDetails
columns.description: A record of each step of authentication undertaken in the sign-in.

columns.name: AuthenticationMethodsUsed
columns.description: List of authentication methods used.

columns.name: AuthenticationProcessingDetails
columns.description: Provides the details associated with authentication processor.

columns.name: AuthenticationProtocol
columns.description: Lists the protocol type or grant type used in the authentication. The possible values are: none, oAuth2, ropc, wsFederation, saml20, deviceCode, unknownFutureValue. For authentications that use protocols other than the possible values listed, the protocol type is listed as none.

columns.name: AuthenticationRequirement
columns.description: Type of authentication required for the sign-in.  If set to multiFactorAuthentication, an MFA step was required.  If set to singleFactorAuthentication, no MFA was required.

columns.name: AuthenticationRequirementPolicies
columns.description: Set of CA policies that apply to this sign-in, each as CA: policy name, and/or MFA: Per-user.

columns.name: AutonomousSystemNumber
columns.description: Autonomous System Number for the network.

columns.name: ClientAppUsed
columns.description: Details outlining app auth used (Legacy vs non Legacy) Eg: Modern Browser, Native App, Exchange Activty Sync and Older Clients.

columns.name: ClientCredentialType
columns.description: The type of client credential used. Examples include client assertion, client secret, etc.

columns.name: ConditionalAccessPolicies
columns.description: Details of the conditional access policies being applied for the sign-in.

columns.name: ConditionalAccessPoliciesV2
columns.description: [Deprecated. Use ConditionalAccessPolicies instead]. Details of the conditional access policies being applied for the sign-in.

columns.name: ConditionalAccessStatus
columns.description: Status of all the conditionalAccess policies related to the sign-in.

columns.name: CreatedDateTime
columns.description: Datetime of the sign-in activity.

columns.name: CrossTenantAccessType
columns.description: Describes the type of cross-tenant access used by the actor to access the resource. Possible values are: none, b2bCollaboration, b2bDirectConnect, microsoftSupport, serviceProvider, unknownFutureValue. If the sign in did not cross tenant boundaries, the value is none.

columns.name: DeviceDetail
columns.description: Details of the device used for the sign-in.

columns.name: FederatedCredentialId
columns.description: Federated Credential Id.

columns.name: GlobalSecureAccessIpAddress
columns.description: Global secure IP address that user signed in from.

columns.name: HomeTenantId
columns.description: The home tenant ID for cross-tenant scenarios.

columns.name: HomeTenantName
columns.description: The tenant name of the external tenant who homes the entitity taking action in the customer's tenant.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: Unique ID representing the sign-in activity.

columns.name: IncomingTokenType
columns.description: The type of token utilized to signIn (examples: primary refresh token, saml assertion).

columns.name: IPAddress
columns.description: IP address of the client used to sign in.

columns.name: IsInteractive
columns.description: Indicates if a sign-in is interactive or not.

columns.name: IsRisky
columns.description: Indicates if a sign-in is considered risky or not.

columns.name: IsTenantRestricted
columns.description: Indicates if a signIn is under a tenant restrictions policy or not.

columns.name: IsThroughGlobalSecureAccess
columns.description: Displays whether or not a user came through Global Secure Access service or not.

columns.name: LocationDetails
columns.description: Details of the sign-in location.

columns.name: MfaDetail
columns.description: Details of the Multi-factor authentication.

columns.name: NetworkLocationDetails
columns.description: Provides the details associated with authentication processor.

columns.name: OriginalRequestId
columns.description: The request id of the first request in the authentication sequence.

columns.name: OriginalTransferMethod
columns.description: Transfer method used to initiate a session throughout all subsequent requests.

columns.name: ProcessingTimeInMs
columns.description: Request processing time in milliseconds in AD STS.

columns.name: ResourceDisplayName
columns.description: Name of the resource that the user signed into.

columns.name: ResourceIdentity
columns.description: ID of the resource that the user signed into.

columns.name: ResourceOwnerTenantId
columns.description: The tenant identifier of the owner of the resource referenced in the sign in.

columns.name: ResourceServicePrincipalId
columns.description: Service Principal Id of the resource.

columns.name: ResourceTenantId
columns.description: The resource tenant ID for cross-tenant scenarios.

columns.name: RiskDetail
columns.description: Risky user state details.

columns.name: RiskEventTypes
columns.description: The list of risk event types associated with the sign-in.

columns.name: RiskEventTypes_V2
columns.description: The list of risk event types associated with the sign-in. These are strings.

columns.name: RiskLevelAggregated
columns.description: Aggregated risk level.

columns.name: RiskLevelDuringSignIn
columns.description: Risk level during sign-in.

columns.name: RiskState
columns.description: Risky user state.

columns.name: ServicePrincipalId
columns.description: ID of the service principal who initiated the sign-in.

columns.name: SessionId
columns.description: Id of the session that was generated during the signIn.

columns.name: SessionLifetimePolicies
columns.description: Policies and settings that applied to the sign-in that enforced or revoked a session lifetime.

columns.name: SignInEventTypes
columns.description: The types that are associated with the sign-in.  Examples include "interactive", "refreshToken", "managedIdentity", "continuousAccessEvaluation" and many more.

columns.name: SignInIdentifierType
columns.description: The type of sign in identifier. Possible values are: userPrincipalName, phoneNumber, proxyAddress, qrCode, onPremisesUserPrincipalName, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: TokenProtectionStatusDetails
columns.description: Token protection creates a cryptographically secure tie between the token and the device it's issued to. This field indicates whether the signin token was bound to the device or not.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: Details of the sign-in status.

columns.name: TokenIssuerName
columns.description: Name of the identity provider (e.g. sts.microsoft.com ).

columns.name: TokenIssuerType
columns.description: Type of identityProvider (Azure AD, AD Federation Services).

columns.name: UniqueTokenIdentifier
columns.description: Unique token identifier for the request.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: User Agent for the sign-in.

columns.name: UserDisplayName
columns.description: Display name of the user that initiated the sign-in.

columns.name: UserId
columns.description: ID of the user that initiated the sign-in.

columns.name: UserPrincipalName
columns.description: User principal name of the user that initiated the sign-in.

columns.name: UserType
columns.description: Identifies whether the user is a member or guest in the tenant. Possible values are: member, guest, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: IPAddress

columns.description: Thumbprint of the service principal that initiated the sign-in

columns.name: AADTenantId
columns.description: ID of the AAD tenant.

tables.name: AADProvisioningLogs
tables.description: Logs generated by Azure AD Provisioning.

columns.name: AADTenantId
columns.description: Unique Azure AD tenant ID

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: Name of the operation

columns.name: OperationVersion
columns.description: The REST API version that's requested by the client

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Category of the event

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The result of the provisioning operation can be Success, Failure, or Skipped

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: Contains the error code, if any, for the provisioning operation

columns.name: ResultDescription
columns.description: When available, provides the error description for the provisioning operation

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: Indicates how long this provisioning action took to finish

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: ID to provide provisioning trail

columns.name: Action
columns.description: Indicates the activity name or the operation name. For a list of activities logged, refer to Azure AD activity list

columns.name: ChangeId
columns.description: Unique ID of this change in this cycle

columns.name: CycleId
columns.description: Unique ID per job iteration

columns.name: Id
columns.description: Indicates the unique ID for the activity

columns.name: InitiatedBy
columns.description: Details of who initiated this provisioning

columns.name: JobId
columns.description: The unique ID for the whole provisioning job

columns.name: ModifiedProperties
columns.description: Details of each property that was modified in this provisioning action on this object

columns.name: ProvisioningSteps
columns.description: Details of each step in provisioning

columns.name: ServicePrincipal
columns.description: Represents the service principal used for provisioning

columns.name: SourceIdentity
columns.description: Details of source object being provisioned

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: Details of source system of the object being provisioned

columns.name: StatusInfo
columns.description: Details of provisioning status

columns.name: TargetIdentity
columns.description: Details of target object being provisioned

columns.name: TargetSystem
columns.description: Details of target system of the object being provisioned

columns.name: ProvisioningAction
columns.description: Indicates the activity name or the operation name. For a list of activities logged, refer to Azure AD activity list

columns.name: ProvisioningStatusInfo
columns.description: Details of provisioning status

tables.name: ADFSSignInLogs

columns.name: TenantId
columns.description: The tenant GUID that's associated with the logs

columns.description: Details of source system of the object being provisioned

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: For sign-ins, this value is always Sign-in activity

columns.description: The REST API version that's requested by the client

columns.name: Category

columns.name: AppDisplayName

columns.name: AppId

columns.name: AuthenticationDetails
columns.description: A record of each step of authentication undertaken in the sign-in

columns.name: AuthenticationRequirement
columns.description: Type of authentication required for the sign-in.  If set to multiFactorAuthentication, an MFA step was required.  If set to singleFactorAuthentication, no MFA was required

columns.name: AuthenticationRequirementPolicies
columns.description: Set of CA policies that apply to this sign-in, each as CA: policy name, and/or MFA: Per-user

columns.name: ConditionalAccessPolicies
columns.description: Details of the conditional access policies being applied for the sign-in

columns.description: Indicates if a sign-in is interactive or not

columns.description: Unique ID representing the sign-in activity

columns.description: IP address of the client used to sign in

columns.name: NetworkLocationDetails
columns.description: Provides the details associated with authentication processor

columns.name: OriginalRequestId
columns.description: The request id of the first request in the authentication sequence

columns.name: ProcessingTimeInMs
columns.description: Request processing time in milliseconds in AD STS

columns.description: The string name of the application the user signed into displayed in the Azure Portal

columns.name: ResourceIdentity
columns.description: A unique ID application ID the user signed into of the request

columns.name: ResourceTenantId
columns.description: The resource tenant ID for cross-tenant scenarios

columns.name: Requirement

columns.name: Status

tables.name: AADUserRiskEvents
tables.description: Logs generated by identity protection for Azure AD user risk events.

columns.name: Activity
columns.description: Indicates the activity type the detected risk is linked to. Possible values are: signin, user, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: ActivityDateTime
columns.description: Date and time when the risky activity occurred in UTC.

columns.name: AdditionalInfo
columns.description: Additional information associated with the user risk event in JSON format.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: Correlation ID of the sign-in associated with the risk detection. This property is null if the risk detection is not associated with a sign-in.

columns.name: DetectedDateTime
columns.description: Date and time that the risk was detected in UTC.

columns.name: DetectionTimingType
columns.description: Timing of the detected risk (real-time/offline). Possible values are: notDefined, realtime, nearRealtime, offline, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: Unique ID of the risk event.

columns.name: IpAddress
columns.description: The IP address of the client from where the risk occurred.

columns.name: LastUpdatedDateTime
columns.description: Date and time when the risk detection was last updated in UTC.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: Location of the sign-in.

columns.name: RequestId
columns.description: Request ID of the sign-in associated with the risk detection. This property is null if the risk detection is not associated with a sign-in.

columns.name: RiskDetail
columns.description: Details of the detected risk. Possible values are: none, adminGeneratedTemporaryPassword, userPerformedSecuredPasswordChange, userPerformedSecuredPasswordReset, adminConfirmedSigninSafe, aiConfirmedSigninSafe, userPassedMFADrivenByRiskBasedPolicy, adminDismissedAllRiskForUser, adminConfirmedSigninCompromised, hidden, adminConfirmedUserCompromised, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: RiskEventType
columns.description: The type of risk event detected.

columns.name: RiskLevel
columns.description: Level of the detected risk. Possible values are: low, medium, high, hidden, none, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: RiskState
columns.description: The state of a detected risky user or sign-in. Possible values are: none, confirmedSafe, remediated, dismissed, atRisk, confirmedCompromised, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: Source
columns.description: Source of the risk detection. For example, activeDirectory.

columns.name: TokenIssuerType
columns.description: Indicates the type of token issuer for the detected sign-in risk. Possible values are: AzureAD, ADFederationServices, UnknownFutureValue.

columns.name: UserDisplayName
columns.description: The user principal name (UPN) of the user.

columns.name: UserId
columns.description: Unique ID of the user.

columns.name: UserPrincipalName
columns.description: The user principal name (UPN) of the user.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: Name of the operation.

tables.name: AADRiskyUsers
tables.description: Logs generated by identity protection for Azure AD risky users.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: Unique ID of the user at risk.

columns.name: IsDeleted
columns.description: Indicates whether the user is deleted.

columns.name: IsProcessing
columns.description: Indicates whether a user's risky state is being processed by the backend.

columns.name: RiskDetail
columns.description: Details of the detected risk. Possible values are: none, adminGeneratedTemporaryPassword, userPerformedSecuredPasswordChange, userPerformedSecuredPasswordReset, adminConfirmedSigninSafe, aiConfirmedSigninSafe, userPassedMFADrivenByRiskBasedPolicy, adminDismissedAllRiskForUser, adminConfirmedSigninCompromised, hidden, adminConfirmedUserCompromised, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: RiskLastUpdatedDateTime
columns.description: The date and time that the risky user was last updated in UTC.

columns.name: RiskLevel
columns.description: Level of the detected risky user. Possible values are: low, medium, high, hidden, none, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: RiskState
columns.description: State of the user's risk. Possible values are: none, confirmedSafe, remediated, dismissed, atRisk, confirmedCompromised, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: UserDisplayName
columns.description: Risky user display name.

columns.name: UserPrincipalName
columns.description: Risky user principal name.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: Name of the operation.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated log analytics events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

tables.name: AADServicePrincipalRiskEvents
tables.description: Logs generated by identity protection for Azure AD service principal risk events.

columns.name: Activity
columns.description: Indicates the activity type the detected risk is linked to.

columns.name: ActivityDateTime
columns.description: Date and time when the risky activity occurred in UTC.

columns.name: AdditionalInfo
columns.description: Additional information associated with the risk detection in JSON format.

columns.name: AppId
columns.description: The unique identifier for the associated application.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: Correlation ID of the sign-in activity associated with the risk detection. Nullable.

columns.name: DetectedDateTime
columns.description: Date and time when the risk was detected in UTC.

columns.name: DetectionTimingType
columns.description: Timing of the detected risk , whether real-time or offline.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: Unique identifier of the risk detection. Inherited from entity.

columns.name: IpAddress
columns.description: Provides the IP address of the client from where the risk occurred.

columns.name: KeyIds
columns.description: The unique identifier (GUID) for the key credential associated with the risk detection.

columns.name: LastUpdatedDateTime
columns.description: Date and time when the risk detection was last updated in UTC.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: Location of the sign-in.

columns.name: RequestId
columns.description: Request identifier of the sign-in activity associated with the risk detection. Nullable.

columns.name: RiskDetail
columns.description: Details of the detected risk. Note: Details for this property are only available for Azure AD Premium P2 customers.

columns.name: RiskEventType
columns.description: The type of risk event detected.

columns.name: RiskLevel
columns.description: Level of the detected risk. Note: details for this property are only available for Azure AD Premium P2 customers.

columns.name: RiskState
columns.description: The state of a detected risky service principal or sign-in activity.

columns.name: ServicePrincipalDisplayName
columns.description: The display name for the service principal.

columns.name: ServicePrincipalId
columns.description: The unique identifier for the service principal.

columns.name: Source
columns.description: Source of the risk detection. For example, identityProtection.

columns.name: TokenIssuerType
columns.description: Indicates the type of token issuer for the detected sign-in risk.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: Name of the operation.

tables.name: AADRiskyServicePrincipals
tables.description: Logs generated by identity protection for Azure AD risky service principals.

columns.name: AccountEnabled
columns.description: true if the service principal account is enabled; otherwise, false.

columns.name: AppId
columns.description: The globally unique identifier for the associated application (its appId property), if any.

columns.name: DisplayName
columns.description: The display name for the service principal.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: The unique identifier assigned to the service principal at risk. Inherited from entity.

columns.name: IsProcessing
columns.description: Indicates whether Azure AD is currently processing the service principal's risky state.

columns.name: RiskDetail
columns.description: Details of the detected risk.

columns.name: RiskLastUpdatedDateTime
columns.description: The date and time that the risk state was last updated in UTC.

columns.name: RiskLevel
columns.description: Level of the detected risky workload identity. The possible values are: low, medium, high, hidden, none, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: RiskState
columns.description: State of the service principal's risk. The possible values are: none, confirmedSafe, remediated, dismissed, atRisk, confirmedCompromised, unknownFutureValue.

columns.name: ServicePrincipalType
columns.description: Identifies whether the service principal represents an Application, a Managed Identity, or a legacy application (social IdP).

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the event in UTC.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: Name of the operation.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated log analytics events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

tables.name: AADB2CRequestLogs
tables.description: [Deprecated. Do not onboard any new users.] Logs generated by AAD gateway for displaying B2C tenant's web requests and its throttle info.

columns.name: AADTenantId
columns.description: The AAD tenant ID of associated request.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: Indicates whether the request is throttled or not.

columns.name: ResultSignature
columns.description: The HTTP status code of the corresponding REST call.

columns.name: CallerIpAddress
columns.description: Hashed format of caller IP address. Can be used to identify if a single IP address is using a large portion of traffic.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time of the request received at the AAD gateway in UTC.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: Name of the operation.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: The ID for correlated log analytics events. Can be used to identify correlated events between multiple tables.

tables.name: NetworkAccessTraffic
tables.description: This table is part of Identity and Network Access, which contains Network Traffic Access logs. These logs can be leveraged for policy, risk, and traffic management, as well as to monitor users experience.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time (UTC) that the event was generated.

columns.name: TransactionId
columns.description: Unique identifier that representing a roundtrip of request response.

columns.name: ConnectionId
columns.description: Unique identifier representing the connection this traffic log was initiated from.

columns.name: SessionId
columns.description: Unique identifier representing the session.

columns.name: TrafficType
columns.description: The type of the target destination traffic.

columns.name: DeviceCategory
columns.description: Device type the transaction originated from. Client, Branch.

columns.name: DestinationIp
columns.description: The IP address of the connection or session destination.
The destination IP port.

columns.name: DestinationFqdn
columns.description: The destination device hostname, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SourceIp
columns.description: The IP address from which the connection or session originated.
The IP port from which the connection originated.

columns.name: DeviceOperatingSystem
columns.description: The client connecting operating system type.

columns.name: DeviceOperatingSystemVersion
columns.description: The client connecting operating system version.

columns.name: AgentVersion
columns.description: The version of the agent connecting.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: The ID of the source device as reported in the record.

columns.name: UserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the source user.

columns.name: UserPrincipalName
columns.description: The source username, including domain information when available.

columns.name: TransportProtocol
columns.description: The IP protocol used by the connection or session as listed in IANA protocol assignment.

columns.name: NetworkProtocol
columns.description: The network protocol, IPv6 or IPv4.

columns.name: Action
columns.description: The action taken on the network session. Allowed, Denied.

columns.name: PolicyRuleId
columns.description: The ID of the rule for which the request was denied by.

columns.name: PolicyId
columns.description: The ID of the policy for which the request was denied by its rule.

columns.name: SentBytes
columns.description: The number of bytes sent.

columns.name: ReceivedBytes
columns.description: The number of bytes received.

columns.name: ReferrerHeader
columns.description: The Referer header value.

columns.name: OriginHeader
columns.description: The origin header value.

columns.name: XForwardedFor
columns.description: X-Forwarded-For header of the HTTP request.

columns.name: DestinationWebCategories
columns.description: The destination FQDN's Web Categories.

columns.name: FilteringProfileId
columns.description: The ID of the Filtering Profile associated with the action performed on traffic.

columns.name: FilteringProfileName
columns.description: The name of the Filtering Profile associated with the action performed on traffic.

columns.name: PolicyName
columns.description: The name of the filtering policy associated with the action performed on traffic.

columns.name: RuleName
columns.description: The name of the rule associated with the action performed on traffic.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessName
columns.description: The process initiating the traffic transaction.

columns.name: ResourceTenantId
columns.description: Tenant ID that owns the resource.

columns.name: ThreatType
columns.description: The identified threat type associated with the traffic.

columns.name: DestinationUrl
columns.description: The Url link of the connection or session destination.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: Additional details describing the traffic.

columns.name: AppId
columns.description: Destination Application ID accessed in Azure AD during the transaction.

columns.name: ConnectorId
columns.description: Private access connector ID.

columns.name: ConnectorName
columns.description: Private access connector name.

columns.name: ConnectorIp
columns.description: Private access connector IP.

columns.name: ConnectionStatus
columns.description: Status of a connection. Status options: Open, Active, Closed.

columns.name: AccessType
columns.description: Type of accessed application. Access type options: QuickAccess, PrivateAccess.

columns.name: ProcessingRegion
columns.description: Region where the request was processed by the backend service.

columns.name: AppSegmentId
columns.description: Destination Application segment ID from Azure AD accessed during the transaction

columns.name: RemoteNetworkId
columns.description: The ID from which traffic was sent or received, providing visibility into the origin of the traffic.

columns.name: HttpMethod
columns.description: The http method used in the request.

columns.name: ResponseCode
columns.description: The response code returned from the server.

columns.name: Token3PExpiry
columns.description: The expiry date of the access token used to access the private access application.

columns.name: Token3PValidFrom
columns.description: The validity date of the access token used to access the private access application.

columns.name: Token3PIssuedAt
columns.description: The issued date of the access token used to access the private access application.

columns.name: Token3PUniqueId
columns.description: The unique token identifier of the access token used to access the private access application.

columns.name: TlsAction
columns.description: The TLS action taken on the traffic.

columns.name: TlsStatus
columns.description: The status of the Tls option.

columns.name: TlsPolicyId
columns.description: The unique token identifier of the TLS policy applied to the traffic.

columns.name: TlsPolicyName
columns.description: The name for the TLS policy applied to the traffic.

columns.name: UniqueTokenId
columns.description: The unique token identifier

columns.name: VendorNames
columns.description: The name of the vendors who detected the threat.

columns.name: CloudAppCatalogId
columns.description: The id of the application in the saas application catalog.

columns.name: CloudAppName
columns.description: The name of the application (i.e chatGPT, SalesForce, Bing).

columns.name: CloudAppCategory
columns.description: The category of the cloud application (i.e social media, search, generative AI).

columns.name: CloudAppGeneralScore
columns.description: The general score of the application.

columns.name: CloudAppRiskScore
columns.description: The risk score of the application.

columns.name: CloudAppComplianceScore
columns.description: The compliance score of the application.

columns.name: CloudAppLegalScore
columns.description: The legal score of the application.

columns.name: CloudAppLoginUser
columns.description: The username that was used to log into the application.

columns.name: HttpRequestContentType
columns.description: The content type specified in the HTTP request header.

columns.name: HttpUserAgent
columns.description: The user agent string from the HTTP request header.

tables.name: NetworkAccessConnectionEvents
tables.description: This table is part of Identity and Network Access, which contains Network Traffic Connection Events. These logs can be leveraged for security, and traffic management, as well as to monitor users experience.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time (UTC) that the event was generated.

columns.name: ConnectionId
columns.description: Unique identifier representing the connection this traffic log was initiated from.

columns.name: TrafficType
columns.description: The type of the target destination traffic.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: The type of the connection event.

columns.name: DeviceCategory
columns.description: Device type the transaction originated from. Client, Branch.

columns.name: DestinationIp
columns.description: The IP address of the connection or session destination.
The destination IP port.

columns.name: DestinationFqdn
columns.description: The destination device hostname, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SourceIp
columns.description: The IP address from which the connection or session originated.

columns.name: SourcePrivateIp
columns.description: The private IP address from which the connection or session originated.

columns.name: RemoteNetworkSourceIp
columns.description: The Remote Network IP address from which the connection or session originated.
The IP port from which the connection originated.

columns.name: DeviceOperatingSystem
columns.description: The client connecting operating system type.

columns.name: DeviceOperatingSystemVersion
columns.description: The client connecting operating system version.

columns.name: AgentVersion
columns.description: The version of the agent connecting.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: The ID of the source device as reported in the record.

columns.name: UserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the source user.

columns.name: UserPrincipalName
columns.description: The source username, including domain information when available.

columns.name: TransportProtocol
columns.description: The IP protocol used by the connection or session as listed in IANA protocol assignment.

columns.name: NetworkProtocol
columns.description: The network protocol, IPv6 or IPv4.

columns.name: InitiatingProcessName
columns.description: The process initiating the traffic transaction.

columns.name: AppId
columns.description: Destination Application ID accessed in Azure AD during the transaction.

columns.name: PopProcessingRegion
columns.description: Region where the request was processed by the backend service.

columns.name: RemoteNetworkId
columns.description: The ID from which traffic was sent or received, providing visibility into the origin of the traffic.

columns.name: Token3PExpiry
columns.description: The expiry date of the access token used to access the private access application.

columns.name: Token3PValidFrom
columns.description: The validity date of the access token used to access the private access application.

columns.name: Token3PIssuedAt
columns.description: The issued date of the access token used to access the private access application.

columns.name: Token3PUniqueId
columns.description: The unique token identifier of the access token used to access the private access application.

tables.name: RemoteNetworkHealthLogs
tables.description: This table is part of Identity and Network Access, which contains Remote Network Health logs. These logs can be leveraged for knowing the state of your remote networks health state.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time (UTC) that the event was generated.

columns.name: CreatedDateTime
columns.description: The date and time (UTC) that the event was generated.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each remoteNetworkHealthEvent.

columns.name: RemoteNetworkId
columns.description: A unique identifier for each remoteNetwork site.

columns.name: SourceIp
columns.description: The public IP address.

columns.name: DestinationIp
columns.description: The IP address of the destination.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: Description and summary of the event.

columns.name: BgpRoutesAdvertisedCount
columns.description: Count of BGP routes advertised through tunnel.

columns.name: SentBytes
columns.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination for the connection or session.

columns.name: ReceivedBytes
columns.description: The number of bytes sent from the destination to the source.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: Remote network status. Possible values are: tunnelDisconnected, tunnelConnected, bgpDisconnected, bgpConnected, remoteNetworkAlive, unknownFutureValue.

tables.name: EnrichedMicrosoft365AuditLogs
tables.description: This table is part of Identity and Network Access, which contains Enriched Microsoft 365 Audit logs. These logs can be leveraged for policy, risk, and traffic management, as well as to monitor users experience.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time in UTC when the user performed the activity.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: Unique identifier of an audit record.

columns.name: RecordType
columns.description: The type of operation indicated by the record. See the AuditLogRecordType table for details on the types of audit log records.

columns.name: Operation
columns.description: The name of the user or admin activity that performed the activity.

columns.name: OrganizationId
columns.description: The GUID for your organization's Office 365 tenant. This value will always be the same for your organization, regardless of the Office 365 service in which it occurs.

columns.name: UserType
columns.description: The type of user that performed the operation.

columns.name: ActorUserType
columns.description: The type of user that performed the operation. Possible types includes: Admin, System, Application, Service Principal and Other.

columns.name: UserKey
columns.description: An alternative ID for the user identified in the UserId property. For example, this property is populated with the passport unique ID (PUID) for events performed by users in SharePoint, OneDrive for Business, and Exchange. This property may also specify the same value as the UserID property for events occurring in other services and events performed by system accounts.

columns.name: Workload
columns.description: The Office 365 service where the activity occurred.

columns.name: ResultStatus
columns.description: Indicates whether the action (specified in the Operation property) was successful or not. Possible values are Succeeded, PartiallySucceeded, or Failed.

columns.name: ObjectId
columns.description: For SharePoint and OneDrive for business activity, the full path name of the file or folder accessed by the user. For Exchange admin audit logging, the name of the object that was modified by the cmdlet.

columns.name: UserId
columns.description: The UPN (User Principal Name) of the user who performed the action (specified in the Operation property) that resulted in the record being logged; for example, my_name@my_domain_name. Note that records for activity performed by system accounts (such as SHAREPOINT\system or NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM) are also included. In SharePoint, another value display in the UserId property is app@sharepoint. This indicates that the "user" who performed the activity was an application that has the necessary permissions in SharePoint to perform organization-wide actions (such as search a SharePoint site or OneDrive account) on behalf of a user, admin, or service. For more information, see the app@sharepoint user in audit records.

columns.name: ClientIp
columns.description: The IP address of the device that was used when the activity was logged. The IP address is displayed in either an IPv4 or IPv6 address format. For some services, the value displayed in this property might be the IP address for a trusted application (for example, Office on the web apps) calling into the service on behalf of a user and not the IP address of the device used by person who performed the activity. Also, for Azure Active Directory-related events, the IP address isn't logged and the value for the ClientIP property is null.

columns.name: UniqueTokenId
columns.description: The unique token identifier

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: The ID of the source device as reported in the record.

columns.name: DeviceOperatingSystem
columns.description: The client connecting operating system type.

columns.name: DeviceOperatingSystemVersion
columns.description: The client connecting operating system version.

columns.name: SourceIp
columns.description: The IP address from which the connection or session originated.

columns.name: AdditionalProperties
columns.description: Additional activity fields

tables.name: NetworkAccessAlerts
tables.description: This table is part of Identity and Network Access, which contains Network Access Alerts. These Alerts can be leveraged for knowing the state of your network access.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The date and time (UTC) that the event was generated.

columns.name: CreationDateTime
columns.description: The date and time (UTC) that the event was generated.

columns.name: FirstActivityDateTime
columns.description: The impact start time of the alert (the time of the first event or activity included in the alert). The field is serialized a string according to ISO8601, including UTC timezone information.

columns.name: LastActivityDateTime
columns.description: The impact end time of the alert (the time of the last event or activity included in the alert). The field is serialized a string according to ISO8601, including UTC timezone information.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each Network Access Alert.

columns.name: VendorName
columns.description: The name of the vendor that raised the alert, this value is displayed to users as is. For most internal security products alerts it should be set as ‘Microsoft’.

columns.name: ProductName
columns.description: The name of the product which published this alert, i.e. Azure Security Center, Azure ATP, Microsoft Defender ATP, O365 ATP, MCAS, etc.

columns.name: ComponentName
columns.description: The name of a component inside the product which generated the alert. This is an optional field, which might be populated only for product in which external end user are aware of specific components within a product. For products that offer different types of SKU/Bundles, this field can hold the SKU or bundle name.

columns.name: AlertType
columns.description: The type name of the alert. Alerts of the same type should have the same name. This field is a keyed string representing the type of alert and not of an alert instance. All alert instances from the same detection logic/analytic should have the same value for alert type.

columns.name: DisplayName
columns.description: The display name of the alert, this value is displayed to users either as-is or with additional parameters.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination for the connection or session.

columns.name: Severity
columns.description: The severity of the alert as it is reported by the provider. Possible Values: Informational, Low, Medium, High.

columns.name: Techniques
columns.description: Optional field that specify the kill chain related techniques behind the alert. Each technique should be added in this list using its ID and it should have at least one matching intent in the Intent field. The Production of this field (the expected format of the technique ID and the matching against the Intent values) follow MITRE att@ck enterprise matrix model (Opens in new window or tab), and further guidance on the different techniques that make up each intent can be found in MITRE's documentation.

columns.name: SubTechniques
columns.description: Optional field that specify the kill chain related sub-techniques behind the alert. Each sub-technique should be added in this list using its ID and it should have at least one matching intent in the Intent field.

columns.name: DetectionTechnology
columns.description: Optional field to hold the alert threat detection technology.

columns.name: PolicyId
columns.description: The Policy Id associated with the network access traffic that generated the Alert.

columns.name: IsPreview
columns.description: IsPreview will be defined as true where the alert is in public preview state and not eligible for GA yet. By default the value is false.

columns.name: ExtendedProperties
columns.description: A bag of fields which will be presented to the user. Providers can send here any custom fields that should be part of the alert.

columns.name: RelatedResources
columns.description: A list of entities related to the alert. This list can hold a mixture of entities of diverse types. The entities type can be any of the types defined in the Entities section. Entities which are not in the list below can also be sent, however it is not guaranteed that they will be processed (the alert will not fail Production with new types of entities).

queries.description: Gets list of the top 100 at high risk users for the last day.
Gets list of the top 100 active user risk events.
Gets a list of active service principal risk detections.
Gets a list of active user risk detections.
Gets list of top 100 most active service principals for the last day.
Service principals that had no sign-ins for the last 30d.
Get list of users that signed in from multiple cities for the last day.
Get list of top 100 most active IP addresses for the last day.
Gets list of top 100 most active managed identities for the last day.

queries.displayName: Provisioning actions for the last week
queries.description: Shows the number of users and groups created, updated, disabled, and deleted in the past 7 days.
Shows the count per error code and when were they last seen.
Summarizes for each day the number of created objects per day.
Returns top 10 IP addresses by number of lockouts.
Returns custom security attribute audit logs for a specific user.
